meanings.definition: The state or quality of being unreliable.
meanings.sent1: The unreliabilities of the old clock made it hard to trust the time.
meanings.sent2: She was frustrated by the unreliabilities of the weather forecast.
meanings.sent3: The unreliabilities of the magic potion led to some comical mix-ups.
meanings.sent4: The unreliabilities of the compass left them lost in the woods.
meanings.sent5: The unreliabilities of the student's excuses were as clear as day.

meanings.definition: Instances or occurrences of being unreliable.
meanings.sent1: The car's unreliabilities always seemed to happen at the worst times.
meanings.sent2: Dealing with unreliabilities in technology can be frustrating.
meanings.sent3: The unreliabilities of the robot's movements made it look like it was dancing.
meanings.sent4: The unreliabilities of the bridge's structure were a disaster waiting to happen.
meanings.sent5: The unreliabilities of the witness's testimony raised doubts about the case.
